text: == Background == Phunware, Inc. (NASDAQ: PHUN) is an Austin, Texas based technology company founded in 2009. Phunware also has offices in Irvine, California, San Diego, California, and Miami, Florida. The company has acquired companies such as Odyssey, Simplikate, Digby, Tapit! ($23 million acquisition in 2017) and GoTV. Their customers in 2019 include Fox Networks Group, HID Global, American Made Media Consultants, Presidio Networked Solutions, and MD Anderson. Previous customers included Warner Brothers, NASCAR, NFL, and NBC Sports. Phunware performed a reverse merger with Stellar Acquisitions III, a special-purpose acquisition company (or shell company) in December 2018, placing Phunware on NASDAQ. Through a multi-million dollar contract awarded by Brad Parscale's American Made Media Consultants (AMMC), Phunware designed, built and supports the Trump 2020 campaign’s iOS and Android mobile application portfolios. Phunware provides software, infrastructure and services specific to these mobile applications, but Phunware has never been contracted by AMMC or any of its affiliates for its media and data software or services despite several reports to the contrary. Click here for more on Phunware's contract with AMMC. == Platform == Phunware is the pioneer of Multiscreen-as-a-Service (MaaS), a fully integrated enterprise cloud platform for mobile that provides companies the products, solutions, data and services necessary to engage, manage, and monetize their mobile application portfolios and audiences globally at scale. Phunware helps the world’s most respected brands create category-defining mobile experiences, with approximately one billion active devices touching its platform each month. Phunware's products and solutions are commercially available today off- the-shelf, but Phunware can also design, build and support custom optimizations based on a customer's specific needs such as: * Smart Workplace for corporations * Smart Campus for institutes of higher education * Smart City for government officials * Digital Front Door for healthcare * Advocacy for politicians == Financials == The company's non-GAAP adjusted net revenues were stated at $19 million in 2019, down from $22.5 million in 2018. The GAAP gross revenue was $19 million in 2019 and $30.8 million in 2018. Fox Networks Group was 50% of the company's 2019 sales, up from 42% the previous year. The company had 93 employees at the end of 2019, after reducing its workforce by 44. In March 2020, the company furloughed 37 people in response to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. On April 10, 2020, Phunware received $2.8 million in federally backed small business loans from JP Morgan Chase as part of the Paycheck Protection Program. The company received scrutiny over this loan for its connections to Trump and Fox News. In defense, Crowder (COO) said companies that didn't apply "aren't doing their fiduciary duty" and was interviewed on the matter by Proactive Investors and Spectrum News. == Investor Relations == Phunware's Board of Directors can be found here. Phunware's SEC filings can be found here. Phunware's financial information can be found here. == Legal Matters == In September 2017, Phunware sued Uber Technologies for $3 million in unpaid services. Phunware ultimately settled with Uber on in October 2020 according to a recent Form 8-K. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Companies based in Austin, Texas Category:Companies established in 2009
title: Phunware
